New Records: Ireland's George Dockrell took 2-16 to lead the Irish attack
Liam Livingstone took 3-17 in three overs and missed a hat trick
Key Match Events: Ireland posted 157 in 19.2 overs with skipper Andy Balbirnie belting 62 from 47 balls
England finished 105 for five from 14.3 overs
Ben Stokes (6) was bowled by Fionn Hand
Dawid Malan scored 35 off 37 balls to hold the innings together
Pre-Game Insights: England retained the same starting XI that opened the Super 12 stage with a five-wicket win over Afghanistan in Perth last weekend
Ireland made one change, with Hand coming in for batting allrounder Simi Singh
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said 'We were poor in the first 10 overs and let Ireland get away. We let them score freely on both sides and were not consistent [bowling]'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The start was delayed by 15 minutes before another 25-minute delay after only 1.3 overs were bowled
Ireland will play Afghanistan next at the MCG on Friday when England will take on defending champions Australia
